Material used.Material Source: Recombinant proteins overexpressed in Escherichia coli
Material used.Material Name: Wild - type DJ - 1 and its mutants (M26I, E64D, A104T, D149A, L166P)
Material used.Description: Recombinant proteins were overexpressed in Escherichia coli at 37°C using IPTG to induce cultures at mid - log phase (OD600 of 0.6). DJ - 1 and all mutants were found in the soluble fraction after cell lysis and centrifugation.

Readout description.Result Description: The far - UV CD spectrum of L166P DJ - 1 was characteristic of a highly unfolded polypeptide, with a drastic decrease in secondary structure content compared with that of the wild - type protein. It did not exhibit a cooperative unfolding transition. Some degree of residual helical structure was suggested by a shoulder in the spectrum around a wavelength of 222 nm.
The far - UV CD spectrum of the E64D DJ - 1 mutant was nearly identical to that of the wild - type protein, and it melted at the same temperature as the wild - type protein.

The far - UV CD spectra of the M26I mutant was similar in shape to that of the wild - type protein but with a decreased signal amplitude. It melted at a mid - point temperature around 69°C, 8°C below that of the wild - type protein.

The far - UV CD spectra of the A104T mutant was similar in shape to that of the wild - type protein but with a decreased signal amplitude. It melted at a mid - point temperature around 69°C, 8°C below that of the wild - type protein.

The far - UV CD spectra of the D149A mutant was similar in shape to that of the wild - type protein but with a decreased signal amplitude (the effect was most pronounced for this mutant). It melted at a mid - point temperature around 69°C, 8°C below that of the wild - type protein.

Biological replicates.Description: All CD spectra and melting curves were acquired in at least two independent measurements to ensure reproducibility.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: The CD spectrum shape and melting temperature similar to wild - type DJ - 1

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: The CD spectrum shape and melting temperature different from wild - type DJ - 1

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant proteins overexpressed in Escherichia coli
Material used.Material Name: Wild - type DJ - 1 and its mutants (M26I, E64D, A104T, D149A, L166P)
Material used.Description: Recombinant proteins were overexpressed in Escherichia coli at 37°C using IPTG to induce cultures at mid - log phase (OD600 of 0.6). DJ - 1 and all mutants were found in the soluble fraction after cell lysis and centrifugation. Isotopically labeled samples for NMR studies were prepared using M9 minimal media with specific nitrogen and carbon sources.

Readout description.Result Description: The HSQC spectrum of the L166P mutant is poorly dispersed, indicating a largely unfolded polypeptide lacking in tertiary interactions. Some regions of the spectrum exhibit more than one set of resonances, likely due to cis/trans isomerization of the Gly - Pro peptide bond.

The two - dimensional NMR proton - nitrogen correlation spectrum of the E64D DJ - 1 mutant was nearly identical to that of the wild - type protein, with chemical shift deviations essentially restricted to residues adjacent to the site of the mutation.

The two - dimensional NMR spectrum of the M26I mutant exhibits a degree of resonance dispersion equivalent to that of the wild - type protein, but with chemical shift changes indicating local structural perturbations. Residues near the mutation site and in other regions show significant chemical shift changes.

The two - dimensional NMR spectrum of the A104T mutant exhibits a degree of resonance dispersion equivalent to that of the wild - type protein, but with chemical shift changes indicating local structural perturbations. Residues near the mutation site and in other regions show significant chemical shift changes.

The two - dimensional NMR spectrum of the D149A mutant exhibits a degree of resonance dispersion equivalent to that of the wild - type protein, but with chemical shift changes indicating local structural perturbations. Residues near the mutation site and in other regions show significant chemical shift changes.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: The NMR spectrum similar to wild - type DJ - 1 in terms of resonance dispersion and chemical shift

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: The NMR spectrum different from wild - type DJ - 1 in terms of resonance dispersion and chemical shift
